Alasan Daihatsu Indonesia Belum Ada Rencana Jual Rocky
05 Nov 2019, 01:32 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi Daihatsu. (www.daihatsu.com)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- DaihatsuÂ Indonesia belum ada rencana memasarkan Rocky di Indonesia pasca debutnya di Tokyo Motor Show (TMS) 2019 yang baru saja berlangsung Tokyo Big Sight dan Odaiba Area, Jepang.Direktur Marketing Astra Daihatsu Motor (ADM) Amelia Tjandra menilai bila dijual di Indonesia, Rocky akan masuk ke dalam segmen compact SUV, namun peluncurannya di dalam negeri belum mendesak.Di Indonesia, pesaing terdekat Rocky, yaitu Suzuki Ignis, namun dijelaskan Amelia dimensi Rocky lebih besar. Untuk urusan mesin, Ignis tersedia 1.200 cc sedangkan Rocky 1.000 cc turbo."Sekarang itu tidak ada [pesaing Rocky], ada Ignis, tapi lebih kecil [kapasitas mesin Rocky]. Kalau ini Rocky lebih besar dari Ignis [dimensinya]," kata Amelia di Sunter, Jakarta Utara, pekan lalu."Lalu HR-V itu lebih gede, kemudian Jimny lebih kecil [dimensinya daripada Rocky]. Jadi belum ada susah dibandingkan, belum ada kompetitornya. Saya susah menjawab soal Rocky karena memang belum ada planning kami ini. Sampai hari ini belum ada,"ucap Amelia kemudian.Rocky memiliki berat 980 kg dan panjang 3.995 mm, tinggi 1.695 mm, lebar 1.620 mm, dan jarak sumbu roda 2.525 mm. Model ini menggunakan platform Daihatsu New Global Architecture (DNGA).Mesin Rocky 1.000 cc tiga-silinder 12-katup turbo yang bisa melepas untuk 98 tenaga kuda pada 6.000 rpm dan torsi 140,2 nm pada 2.400-4.000 rpm. Mesin itu dikawinkan dengan transmisi CVT. Untuk sementara ini SUV tersebut hanya untuk pasar domestik Jepang.Rocky versi produksi merupakan pengembangan dari SUV konsep DN Trec yang diperkenalkan di TMS 2017. Menggunakan nama Rocky, tapi mobil beda dari jip Rocku yang pernah dijual Daihatsu beberapa tahun silam. Daihatsu pernah meluncurkan jip dengan desain 'serba kotak' dengan karakter jangkung pada Daihatsu Taft keluaran 1988 kode F75 atau biasa dikenal Rocky. Mobil tersebut sempat populer di Indonesia karena 'kebandelan' mesinnya dan kaki-kakinya melibas berbagai kontur jalan. (ryh/mik)

The Reason Daihatsu Indonesia has no plans to sell Rocky
05 Nov 2019, 01:32 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of Daihatsu. (www.daihatsu.com)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Daihatsu Indonesia has no plans to market Rocky in Indonesia after its debut at the Tokyo Motor Show (TMS) 2019 which has just taken place Tokyo Big Sight and Odaiba Area, Japan. Astra Daihatsu Motor (ADM) Marketing Director Amelia Tjandra assessed if sold in Indonesia, Rocky will enter the compact SUV segment, but its domestic launch is not urgent. In Indonesia, Rocky's closest competitor, Suzuki Ignis, explained that Amelia has a larger Rocky dimension. For the engine business, Ignis is available 1,200 cc while the Rocky is 1,000 cc turbo. "Now there are no [Rocky competitors], there is Ignis, but smaller [Rocky's engine capacity]. If this Rocky is bigger than Ignis [its dimensions]," Amelia said in Sunter, North Jakarta, last week. "Then the HR-V was bigger, then Jimny was smaller [dimensions than Rocky]. So there was no difficulty compared, there were no competitors. I had difficulty answering Rocky's problem because there really wasn't any of our planning. "As of today," Amelia said later. Rocky has a weight of 980 kg and a length of 3,995 mm, height of 1,695 mm, width of 1,620 mm, and wheelbase of 2,525 mm. This model uses the Daihatsu New Global Architecture (DNGA) platform. The Rocky 1,000 cc three-cylinder turbo 12-valve engine can release for 98 horsepower at 6,000 rpm and 140.2 nm of torque at 2,400-4,000 rpm. The engine is mated to a CVT transmission. For the time being this SUV is only for the Japanese domestic market. The production version of Rocky is a development of the DN Trec concept SUV which was introduced at TMS 2017. It uses the name Rocky, but it is different from the Rocku Jeep that Daihatsu had sold several years ago. Daihatsu once launched a jeep with a 'all-round box' design with tall characters in the 1988 Daihatsu Taft code F75 or commonly known as Rocky. The car was once popular in Indonesia because of the 'kebandelan' engine and legs bulldoze the contours of the road. (ryh / mic)
